Corporate leaders participating today will deepen their commitments to advancing a future in which tech jobs are accessible for everyone who has something to offer, especially #HBCU graduates. I want to take a moment to thank our partner @Truist for embracing #DiversityInTech.

We’re assessing how COVID-19 has impacted #HBCUs, students & the tech sector.
 
We’re having real talks about exciting advancements and lingering shortcomings of corporate America’s diversity and inclusion efforts. #DiversityInTech

The Trump Administration and Republicans’ failed response to COVID-19 has cost roughly 200,000 American lives and resulted in 6.8 million cases. Instead of taking decisive action to help American families fight this pandemic, Trump Republicans #FailThePeople.

#HBCUs contribute nearly $15 billion annually to our economy and have provided pathways to opportunity for millions of Americans.
 
This includes over 40 percent of all Black engineers – nearly half of whom are Black women.
 
That’s why #DiversityinTech Summit is so important.

These next two days will bring together countless business and HBCU leaders and the nearly 100-member HBCU Caucus for substantive dialogue about increasing and improving our partnerships, with an added focus on addressing COVID-19’s impacts. #DiversityInTech
